thread.title: Plane bound for Buenos Aires 'goes up in flames' on tarmac at JFK airport
thread.title_full: Plane bound for Buenos Aires 'goes up in flames' on tarmac at JFK airport

author: Natalie Evans
title: Plane bound for Buenos Aires 'goes up in flames' on tarmac at JFK airport
text:
News Plane bound for Buenos Aires 'goes up in flames' on tarmac at JFK airport The pilot of the Argentina Airlines flight reported the engine fire late on Thursday night - but bizarrely, authorities could find no trace of the blaze Share The plane appeared to be on fire on the runway at JFK (Photo: twitter/Alice X. Zhang) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Authorities are investigating after a plane appeared to catch fire at New York's Kennedy Airport. 
Pictures appeared to show the jet with flames spewing from the fuselage as it stood on the runway. 
The pilot of the Argentina Airlines flight reported the engine fire late on Thursday night while the plane was on the tarmac preparing for takeoff, police said. 
But Port Authority of New York and New Jersey spokesman Steve Coleman said when rescue trucks arrived they found no evidence of a fire. Read More One witness photographed what appeared to be embers coming from the fuselage (Photo: twitter/Alice X. Zhang) 
The plane, which was headed for Buenos Aires, taxied back to the gate for further examination. 
No injuries were reported. RAF pilot saved 187 on board nose-diving plane after 'another pilot's camera jammed the controls' 
A passenger on board a plane on the runway nearby took a picture of the aircraft with embers coming out. 
She tweeted: "Yeah so Iâ€™m on the runway about to take off and another plane just landed next to us and it was on f**king fire like literal fire." Like us on Facebook
